revised_title: Thermal Adjustment and Respiratory Exchange in Monotremes and Marsupials: A Study in the Development of Homoeothermism
tldr: This study investigates the thermal adjustment and respiratory exchange in monotremes and marsupials, exploring their position in the ascending scale of physiological superiority to the temperature of their environment. The author examines the respiratory activity of various mammals, including reptiles, monotremes, marsupials, and higher mammals, and discusses the experimental methods used to measure CO2 production and temperature variations.
